title: [COMPLETE] Scheduled Maintenance - 30/03/2016
body:
Hi all,

On 30/03/2016 starting at 03:30 AM AEDT we will be disabling ranked ahead of some planned maintenance. At 05:00 AM AEDT, the servers will be shut down and all games currently in progress will end in a draw and stats will not be recorded.   We estimate the battlegrounds will be unavailable for 3 hours.


**Update 30/03/2016 @ 12:00pm AEDT**
Hi folks,

After this mornings maintenance, there was an issue with the OCE server and the way it dealt with Ranked games. This meant that you wouldn't have been able to see your correct rank, and matches ending during this time did not record results or LP. If you played in ranked and the game finished between 9:20am and 10:20am AEDT (Sydney time) today it would have been affected this way.

We're really sorry we didn't catch it earlier, but we've fixed the issue now.

replies.body:

This meant that you wouldn't have been able to see your correct rank, and matches ending during this time did not record results or LP. Mindstar
I can't log into the game any more and riot support isn't working (it keeps logging me out after I sign in). =/

Can't login to the game without using a VPN since last nights downtime.

This seems to be the primary error:

> [ERROR] com.riotgames.platform.gameclient.module.services.RemoteObjectGenerator 0001 ChannelSet ChannelFaultEvent: [ChannelFaultEvent faultCode="Channel.Connect.Failed" faultString="error" **faultDetail="undefined url:'rtmps://prod.oc1.lol.riotgames.com:2099'"** channelId="my-rtmps" type="channelFault" bubbles=false cancelable=false eventPhase=2]

This error happens immediately after authentication has gone through, while on the "logging in" stage of the launcher. If I use a VPN to Netherlands or Singapore(the only two I've tested so far), I am able to login, albeit with lots of latency.

ISP: Foxtel
Location: Perth, WA

Further testing reveals it is the adobe air client specifically that I cannot connect to without a VPN. I am able to log in via a VPN, start a custom game, turn off the VPN, and the custom game automatically reconnects with my own internet connection. Since the VPN is disconnected though, the adobe air client is unable to connect, so once I leave the game, I have to start the process all over again.
